value.content:
Margie’s Travel Presents… 

New York 
The City of New York, often called New York City or simply 

New York, is the most populous city in the United States. 

With an estimated 2015 population of 8,550,405 distributed 

over a land area of about 302.6 square miles, New York 

City is also the most densely populated major city in the 

United States. Located at the southern tip of the state of 

New York, the city is the center of the New York 

metropolitan area, one of the most populous urban 

agglomerations in the world. A global power city, New York 

City exerts a significant impact upon commerce, finance, 

media, art, fashion, research, technology, education, and 

entertainment, its fast pace defining the term New York 

minute. Home to the headquarters of the United Nations, 

New York is an important center for international diplomacy 

and has been described as the cultural and financial capital 

of the world. 

 

New York Hotels 

Margie’s Travel offers the following accommodation options 

in New York: 

The Manhattan Hotel 

Stay in the heart of New York City, within an easy walk to 

Times Square and Broadway. 

The Grand Central Hotel 

Comfortable mid-town hotel. Close to Grand Central 

Station, the Chrysler Building, and the Empire State 

Building. 

The Park Hotel 

Luxurious accommodation in upper Manhattan, with views 

of Central Park. 

 

 

To book your trip to New York, visit www.margiestravel.com

Great Hotel with the best possible location 

The Manhattan Hotel, New York, USA 

8/26/2018 

I love the Manhattan Hotel for its location and the energy of New York city. The hotel is well kept 

and the room size is large for a typical New York City hotel. I can't wait to get back 

Reviewer: Hsiu-ying Zhuang

Excellent Location Comfortable and Friendly Hotel 

The Grand Central Hotel, New York, USA 

10/14/2018 

A perfect hotel for a girls shopping trip to the Big Apple. Located a short walk from Macys and a few 

blocks from the subway at Grand Central Station with the express trains to Uptown and Downtown 

Manhattan. The rooms were a good size (by New York standards) with comfortable beds. The staff 

were friendly and helpful and check-in/check-out was quick and straightforward. The rate was 

excellent and included a more than adequate buffet style breakfast. I would happily stay at this hotel 

again. 

Reviewer: Ananta Nair

Fabulous location but not as fancy as I expected. 

The Manhattan Hotel, New York, USA 

10/19/2018 

The room was not as luxurious as I was expecting. We've stayed in many nicer resorts. It was nice 

and the location is fabulous. You can walk to many New York landmarks. There were a couple of 

minor maintenance issues that needed attention. The front desk employees were more helpful than 

the concierge. I would stay there again because of the location. There was a breakfast available on 

site, but it seemed very pricey for what was offered. There were several good restaurants close by 

that the front desk directed us to. 

Reviewer: Manami Sato

Wherever you want to go, Margie’s Travel can get you there! 

Margie’s Travel is a world-leading travel agency, combining international reach with local 

expertise. Just tell us where you want to go, and we can arrange: 

• Flights 

• Accommodation 

• Transfers 

• Visas 

• Currency Exchange 

• Excursions 

 
Where We Go 
While we can arrange travel to anywhere 
worldwide, we specialize in trips to: 

• Dubai 

• Las Vegas 

• London 

• New York 

• San Francisco 

Who We Are 
Margie’s Travel employs some of the 
best travel experts in the world. Our 
leadership team consists of: 

• Marjorie Long (CEO) 

• Logan Reid (CFO) 

• Emma Luffman (CTO) 

• Deepak Nadar (Strategic Director) 

 

To learn more about us, visit our website at www.margiestravel.com

Great location miserable staff 

The Park Hotel, New York, USA 

11/19/2018 

Just spent 4 nights in this hotel , a group of 14 friends. Hotel is in a great location and rooms are 

cleaned to good standard. The housekeeping staff are very helpful and friendly but the reception 

staff are miserable and rude ( with the exception of Fred). They completely mixed up the booking 

and blamed everyone else but themselves for their incompetence. Everyone was charged a different 

rate if they experienced breakfast dining and they made no excuses for the different charges. We 

booked 2 triple rooms and 4 doubles and they took an extra $160 dollars from my sisters account for 

a third bed which had already been paid for without letting her know . She discovered they had 

taken the payment from her account when she got back home and she now has to try and get the 

money back. The conciege staff are no better. They might know a lot about New York but they know 

very little about good customer service! Having said all that, we still had a great time. You just have 

to be very careful to check your bill before you leave! 

Reviewer: Xin Liao

Excellent location and value for money 

The Manhattan Hotel, New York, USA 

8/11/2018 

A last-minute booking but well worth it! Stayed here from 30 July for 10nts. Spacious rooms and 

friendly staff. The beds are quite heavenly. Nothing much to say about the lobby and the elevators 

though, but it's no biggie. We especially loved the business centre on the 26th floor - 5 computers 

readily available for guests to use, and you can print, too. Times Square is just a 5 minute walk. Close 

to lots of shopping. Subway is almost next door (57th Street) - Columbus Circle is less than a 5min 

walk. Very close to Central Park. We really liked this place. 

Reviewer: Hamsa Nandamuri

Old building just covered up existing problems. 

The Park Hotel, New York, USA 

11/23/2018 

This hotel is right near everything that anyone new to New York may want to do. The hotel is kinda 

cool. Old looking on the outside and the lobby and bar have been updated nicely and there is a nice 

atmosphere there. The rooms were not as cool. When I first walked into my room it smelled like the 

people who had probably just checked out...bad. To remedy, I asked the nice housekeeper for some 

spray and she quickly went in and took care of the problem for me. She even adjusted the heat 

because she thought maybe the old heating system was circulating stagnant, old air. The bathroom 

was roomy but you could see water stains at the top of the shower and the vent in there was dirty. 

After I went to sleep I swear the room smelled a little like pee but I was done complaining for the 

night and new it really was just the air and maybe the carpet a bit. It looked ok but you can see that 

wallpaper had gone over shabby walls. The staff was really nice. They don't check people in until 

four so it was a nice surprise when they tried to accommodate me and they let me check in at noon. 

I was happy about that and they also gave me an apple. :)If you use this hotel just maybe inspect 

your room before finally settling down. They need some work but I wasn't that upset with it. 

Reviewer: Violet Chambers

Very Good 

The Park Hotel, New York, USA 

11/23/2018 

Found the staff very helpful with our situations of early check in, storage , cleaning and help with the 

in room safe. Super service. Very pleasant. Room was clean, beds comfortable, clean, nice linen, and 

very nice room. Very busy hotel but quiet and very well organized staff. Lots of staff to ask questions 

of. Elavator was great with the touch screen. I missed in room coffee but lots of shops nearby, can 

think of 3 offhand that sold coffee and econnomical meals and snacks. And the Deli almost next 

door. Great for people new to this city . Very happy with my choice of this hotel. 

Reviewer: Roy Dibble

Great New York Boutique Hotel in quiet Neighbourhood 

The Grand Central Hotel, New York, USA 

11/8/2018 

This is a lovely hotel in a great area of Manhattan. We were able to walk everywhere and we did just 

that. Grand Central Station is only mins away as are various bars restaurants etc... Thoroughly 

recommend Madison avenue for good value burgers and the like.... The room size is good the bed is 

absolutely fabulously comfy and it was a lovely surprise for my husband to receive a bottle of bubbly 

and a small birthday cake shortly after checking in. Thank you very much !! The rooms were kept 

lovely and clean and we had a glass of wine each evening on the house between 5 and 6 another 

lovely touch. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel and next time we visit New York it will 

definitely be to this hotel. 

Reviewer: Eunice Vinson

Centrally Located 

The Manhattan Hotel, New York, USA 

10/9/2018 

Our experience staying at the Manhattan Hotel was pleasureable. We stayed in a one bedroom and 

it was spacious for New York standards. There was a fitness room on site,but we didn't use the 

facilities. They served fresh coffee and tea and cookies from 11am - 4pm in their Owner's Lounge. 

It's centrally located. We were able to walk to Central Park, Times Square, Broadway and subway 

entrances. 

Reviewer: Aaron Burkholder

Good and Bad 

The Buckingham Hotel, London, UK 

12/29/2018 

The hotel used to be known as the St. James - a fact that most London cabbies will remind you of. It 

is a mystery why the owners chose to rename it with its street  - that is okay in New York but 

apparently not in London according to taxi drivers. The hotel (apartments) boasts a 5 star 5 diamond 

label but probably needs some sprucing up to really merit that. For example, the elevator - sized like 

a coffin - in the building adjacent to the main building has an old worn out carpet and has short jerky 

movements and gets filled quickly resulting in waits at the ground level. On check-in the receptionist 

promised various newspapers the next morning besides the complimentary Independent only to find 

NOTHING delivered. The Independent did arrive on the second morning. The breakfast room is tiny 

and gets filled in rapidly on weekends with the staff valiantly trying to keep guests seated and served 

but usually is unable to cope - example: cappuccino ordered showed up tepid and luke warm. 

Evidently it came from some place far away (probably the hotel next door which management does 

little to let on that it is part of the same ownership). On the plus side, great location - walking 

distance to almost any part of central London. 

Reviewer: Constance Kirkland

Great location overall a nice experience with minor caveats 

The Grand Central Hotel, New York, USA 

10/19/2018 

Overall, a nicely-appointed good mid-price hotel in Midtown.Before you book, ask for a room on a 

higher floor to avoid street noise. We were on 3 and had a sleepless first night. Staff moved us the 

next day. Also be aware that the heat isn't turned on unless it drops below 45 degrees (friendly staff 

shared this with us.) When we asked for heat, they brought a space heater. Cozy rest of stay - so 

both problems corrected.Would stay again if I had business in Midtown nearby. Wouldn't be my first 

choice. 

Reviewer: Tabitha Robertson

Good choice for Murray Hill/Grand Central area 

The Grand Central Hotel, New York, USA 

10/19/2018 

Hotel was well located and close to Grand Central Station - the room was on a non-view side but was 

decent sized (as everyone else has said) for NYC, about 3 feet around the bed, which is okay. The 

mini-bar was well stocked and we did not hear any noise from the other rooms. Nice desk and 

fixtures in the room itself. The bathroom was not the greatest and the shower had low pressure, but 

the bed was extremely comfortable. Staffing was strange - it seemed like there were only 2 people 

who worked there - the bell captain and the reception desk person, and they had a hard time 

handling the 4 people in the lobby when we got there - not sure if this was because it was a Sunday. 

Reviewer: Rafael Howes

Lucky I didn't listen to negative reviews! 

The Park Hotel, New York, USA 

11/22/2018 

I almost cancelled my reservation for this hotel prior to my departure after reading the many 

negative reviews here but given the great price for 5 nights at just US$1,300 including taxes , I took 

the risk. After working for a week in LA, I went to New York for a bit of a break before heading back 

to Melbourne. It has been 13 years since my last visit there.After reading the many negative reviews, 

I prepared for the worst. I entered this large hotel and found the reception area nice, clean and 

spacious and the reception staff were very courteous and welcoming. Could this be the same hotel I 

was reading about on Trip Advisor? They gave me my room key for the 17th floor and I was very 

nervous as I entered the key to open the door. I thought, how bad can the room be? To my shocked 

surprise, the room was bigger than what I thought. The king size bed was massive, the widescreen 

TV was great and the room smelled nice. One last check was the bathroom and, lo and behold, not 

one trace of fungus or odour and, for New York and for a single, it was big enough.I will definitely be 

staying at this hotel again but I will be sure to get the same room as I heard other rooms on the 

lower levels may not be as nice. Given the rate, this hotel was a steal and the location was perfect. It 

was great to leave the hotel at 7.30pm and walk just five minutes to a Broadway play starring Bill 

Pullman and Julia Stiles starting at 8pm. Heaven! Only in New York! 

Reviewer: Delia Barrera

Margie’s Travel Presents… 

San Francisco 
San Francisco, officially the City and County of San 

Francisco, is the cultural, commercial, and financial 

center of Northern California. It is the birthplace of 

the United Nations. Located at the north end of the 

San Francisco Peninsula, San Francisco is about 

47.9 square miles in area, making it the smallest 

county—and the only consolidated city-county—

within the state of California. With a density of about 

18,581 people per square mile, San Francisco is the 

most densely settled large city in California and the 

second-most densely populated major city in the 

United States after New York City. San Francisco is 

the fourth-most populous city in California, after Los 

Angeles, San Diego, and San Jose, and the 13th-

most populous city in the United States—with a 

census-estimated 2016 population of 870,887. The 

city and its surrounding areas are known as the San 

Francisco Bay Area, and are a part of the larger 

OMB-designated San Jose-San Francisco-Oakland 

combined statistical area, the fifth most populous in 

the nation with an estimated population of 8.7 million. 

 

San Francisco Hotels 

Margie’s Travel offers the following accommodation options 

in San Francisco: 

The Lombard Hotel 

Friendly, family-run hotel within easy walking distance to 

popular sights, including the Golden Gate Bridge and the 

Presidio. Free Parking. 

The Wharf Hotel 

Great value accommodation in the heart of the vibrant 

Fisherman’s Wharf area. Continental Breakfast included. 

 

 

 

 

To book your trip to San Francisco, visit www.margiestravel.com

Don't go there 

The Grand Central Hotel, New York, USA 

10/15/2018 

The first room we were given was dark,very small and extremely noisy. The staff leave the radio on 

in the room in a vain attempt to drown it out ! We were told that we couldn't move as the hotel was 

full that night. The receptionist seemed to be expecting our complaint and moved us the next day. 

The source of the noise is a huge air conditioning unit belonging to another hotel. We were moved 

to a room ten floors directly above and the noise was still annoying. Do not stay here if you like 

sleeping at night !I would be surprised if the rooms we stayed in would meet UK standards due to 

the noise levels. 

Reviewer: Akanksha Hegde

A Great Deal If You Can Get It. 

The Manhattan Hotel, New York, USA 

10/7/2018 

My wife and I stayed for a week in September. This was our second stay here. Both times we were in 

a one bedroom suite. The suite consists of a separate bedroom with a king bed, flat screen TV, 

closet, plenty of drawers and a bathroom with tub and shower. Then there is a separate living room 

with a TV, an eating area, a mini kitchen and another bathroom with a shower. There is daily maid 

service, good towels and bath amenities. We were on the 25th floor with an east view and windows 

that opened. The decor is functional, mid-level but clean and more than adequate. On our stay the 

elevators were running and our limited staff encounters were also fine. I read the mixed reviews. I 

know they were having elevator problems but they are now ok. Of course, the location is the best. 

Easy walking distance to MOMA, Lincoln Center, Metropolitan Museum, Central Park, Whole Foods, 

etc. Plenty of restaurants in walking distance and easy subway and bus access. 

Reviewer: Leanne Cooper

Good value - Clean and Convenient 

The Kensington Hotel, London, UK 

3/4/2018 

I stayed two nights here and considered it good value for money. I'd certainly stay there again.I've 

stayed in several budget/tourist hotels in London over the years, and this was definitely one of the 

better ones. My (single) room was spotlessly clean, with a flat screen TV and new bathroom. It was 

on the small side but this is to be expected in London budget hotels. One of it's little quirks was that I 

had to run the shower for a couple of minutes to get hot water in the morning. The odd thing was 

that the hot water in the sink came on straight away! My room was at the back on the third floor so 

noise from outside wasn't a problem, although I noticed that the walls were pretty thin - I could hear 

the people next door if they raised their voices.The Breakfast area was bright and recently 

decorated. Breakfast consisted of juices, teabags and instant coffee, cereal, white and brown sliced 

pan (toasters available), croissants, cheese, fruit and some tempting pastries.The location is not bad, 

just off the Cromwell Road. It's a few minutes walk away from Gloucester Road and Earl's Court Tube 

Stations. The Natural History Museum, Science Museum and the Victoria and Albert Museums are a 

10-15 min. walk away. Hyde Park is a little further. 

Reviewer: Hsiung Chuang
